intro: Leptosiphon parviflorus var. rosaceus, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
